00032 #ifndef __LWIP_OPT_H__
00033 #define __LWIP_OPT_H__
00034 
00035 #include "lwip/debug.h"
00036 /* Include user defined options first */
00037 #include "arch/lwipopts.h"
00038 
00039 /* Define default values for unconfigured parameters. */
00040 
00041 /* Platform specific locking */
00042 
00043 /*
00044  * enable SYS_LIGHTWEIGHT_PROT in lwipopts.h if you want inter-task protection
00045  * for certain critical regions during buffer allocation, deallocation and memory
00046  * allocation and deallocation.
00047  */
00048 #ifndef SYS_LIGHTWEIGHT_PROT
00049 #define SYS_LIGHTWEIGHT_PROT            0
00050 #endif
00051 
00052 #ifndef NO_SYS
00053 #define NO_SYS                          0
00054 #endif
00055 /* ---------- Memory options ---------- */
00056 /* MEM_ALIGNMENT: should be set to the alignment of the CPU for which
00057    lwIP is compiled. 4 byte alignment -> define MEM_ALIGNMENT to 4, 2
00058    byte alignment -> define MEM_ALIGNMENT to 2. */
00059 
00060 #ifndef MEM_ALIGNMENT
00061 #define MEM_ALIGNMENT                   2
00062 #endif
00063 
00064 /* MEM_SIZE: the size of the heap memory. If the application will send
00065 a lot of data that needs to be copied, this should be set high. */
00066 #ifndef MEM_SIZE
00067 #define MEM_SIZE                        1600
00068 #endif
00069 
00070 /* MEMP_NUM_PBUF: the number of memp struct pbufs. If the application
00071    sends a lot of data out of ROM (or other static memory), this
00072    should be set high. */
00073 #ifndef MEMP_NUM_PBUF
00074 #define MEMP_NUM_PBUF                   16
00075 #endif
00076 
00077 /* MEMP_NUM_UDP_PCB: the number of UDP protocol control blocks. One
00078    per active UDP "connection". */
00079 #ifndef MEMP_NUM_UDP_PCB
00080 #define MEMP_NUM_UDP_PCB                4
00081 #endif
00082 /* MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB: the number of simulatenously active TCP
00083    connections. */
00084 #ifndef MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB
00085 #define MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB                5
00086 #endif
00087 /* MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB_LISTEN: the number of listening TCP
00088    connections. */
00089 #ifndef MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB_LISTEN
00090 #define MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB_LISTEN         8
00091 #endif
00092 /* MEMP_NUM_TCP_SEG: the number of simultaneously queued TCP
00093    segments. */
00094 #ifndef MEMP_NUM_TCP_SEG
00095 #define MEMP_NUM_TCP_SEG                16
00096 #endif
00097 /* MEMP_NUM_SYS_TIMEOUT: the number of simulateously active
00098    timeouts. */
00099 #ifndef MEMP_NUM_SYS_TIMEOUT
00100 #define MEMP_NUM_SYS_TIMEOUT            3
00101 #endif
00102 
00103 /* The following four are used only with the sequential API and can be
00104    set to 0 if the application only will use the raw API. */
00105 /* MEMP_NUM_NETBUF: the number of struct netbufs. */
00106 #ifndef MEMP_NUM_NETBUF
00107 #define MEMP_NUM_NETBUF                 2
00108 #endif
00109 /* MEMP_NUM_NETCONN: the number of struct netconns. */
00110 #ifndef MEMP_NUM_NETCONN
00111 #define MEMP_NUM_NETCONN                4
00112 #endif
00113 /* MEMP_NUM_APIMSG: the number of struct api_msg, used for
00114    communication between the TCP/IP stack and the sequential
00115    programs. */
00116 #ifndef MEMP_NUM_API_MSG
00117 #define MEMP_NUM_API_MSG                8
00118 #endif
00119 /* MEMP_NUM_TCPIPMSG: the number of struct tcpip_msg, which is used
00120    for sequential API communication and incoming packets. Used in
00121    src/api/tcpip.c. */
00122 #ifndef MEMP_NUM_TCPIP_MSG
00123 #define MEMP_NUM_TCPIP_MSG              8
00124 #endif
00125 
00126 /* ---------- Pbuf options ---------- */
00127 /* PBUF_POOL_SIZE: the number of buffers in the pbuf pool. */
00128 
00129 #ifndef PBUF_POOL_SIZE
00130 #define PBUF_POOL_SIZE                  16
00131 #endif
00132 
00133 /* PBUF_POOL_BUFSIZE: the size of each pbuf in the pbuf pool. */
00134 
00135 #ifndef PBUF_POOL_BUFSIZE
00136 #define PBUF_POOL_BUFSIZE               128
00137 #endif
00138 
00139 /* PBUF_LINK_HLEN: the number of bytes that should be allocated for a
00140    link level header. */
00141 
00142 #ifndef PBUF_LINK_HLEN
00143 #define PBUF_LINK_HLEN                  0
00144 #endif
00145 
00146 
00147 
00148 /* ---------- ARP options ---------- */
00149 
00151 #ifndef ARP_TABLE_SIZE
00152 #define ARP_TABLE_SIZE                  10
00153 #endif
00154 
00159 #ifndef ARP_QUEUEING
00160 #define ARP_QUEUEING                    1
00161 #endif
00162 
00166 #ifndef ARP_QUEUE_FIRST
00167 #define ARP_QUEUE_FIRST                 0
00168 #endif
00169 
00175 #ifndef ETHARP_ALWAYS_INSERT
00176 #define ETHARP_ALWAYS_INSERT            1
00177 #endif
00178 
00179 /* ---------- IP options ---------- */
00180 /* Define IP_FORWARD to 1 if you wish to have the ability to forward
00181    IP packets across network interfaces. If you are going to run lwIP
00182    on a device with only one network interface, define this to 0. */
00183 #ifndef IP_FORWARD
00184 #define IP_FORWARD                      0
00185 #endif
00186 
00187 /* If defined to 1, IP options are allowed (but not parsed). If
00188    defined to 0, all packets with IP options are dropped. */
00189 #ifndef IP_OPTIONS
00190 #define IP_OPTIONS                      1
00191 #endif
00192 
00199 #ifndef IP_REASSEMBLY
00200 #define IP_REASSEMBLY                   1
00201 #endif
00202 
00204 #ifndef IP_FRAG
00205 #define IP_FRAG                         1
00206 #endif
00207 
00208 /* ---------- ICMP options ---------- */
00209 
00210 #ifndef ICMP_TTL
00211 #define ICMP_TTL                        255
00212 #endif
00213 
00214 /* ---------- DHCP options ---------- */
00215 
00216 #ifndef LWIP_DHCP
00217 #define LWIP_DHCP                       0
00218 #endif
00219 
00220 /* 1 if you want to do an ARP check on the offered address
00221    (recommended). */
00222 #ifndef DHCP_DOES_ARP_CHECK
00223 #define DHCP_DOES_ARP_CHECK             1
00224 #endif
00225 
00226 /* ---------- UDP options ---------- */
00227 #ifndef LWIP_UDP
00228 #define LWIP_UDP                        1
00229 #endif
00230 
00231 #ifndef UDP_TTL
00232 #define UDP_TTL                         255
00233 #endif
00234 
00235 /* ---------- TCP options ---------- */
00236 #ifndef LWIP_TCP
00237 #define LWIP_TCP                        1
00238 #endif
00239 
00240 #ifndef TCP_TTL
00241 #define TCP_TTL                         255
00242 #endif
00243 
00244 #ifndef TCP_WND
00245 #define TCP_WND                         2048
00246 #endif 
00247 
00248 #ifndef TCP_MAXRTX
00249 #define TCP_MAXRTX                      12
00250 #endif
00251 
00252 #ifndef TCP_SYNMAXRTX
00253 #define TCP_SYNMAXRTX                   6
00254 #endif
00255 
00256 
00257 /* Controls if TCP should queue segments that arrive out of
00258    order. Define to 0 if your device is low on memory. */
00259 #ifndef TCP_QUEUE_OOSEQ
00260 #define TCP_QUEUE_OOSEQ                 1
00261 #endif
00262 
00263 /* TCP Maximum segment size. */
00264 #ifndef TCP_MSS
00265 #define TCP_MSS                         128 /* A *very* conservative default. */
00266 #endif
00267 
00268 /* TCP sender buffer space (bytes). */
00269 #ifndef TCP_SND_BUF
00270 #define TCP_SND_BUF                     256
00271 #endif
00272 
00273 /* TCP sender buffer space (pbufs). This must be at least = 2 *
00274    TCP_SND_BUF/TCP_MSS for things to work. */
00275 #ifndef TCP_SND_QUEUELEN
00276 #define TCP_SND_QUEUELEN                4 * TCP_SND_BUF/TCP_MSS
00277 #endif
00278 
00279 
00280 /* Maximum number of retransmissions of data segments. */
00281 
00282 /* Maximum number of retransmissions of SYN segments. */
00283 
00284 /* TCP writable space (bytes). This must be less than or equal
00285    to TCP_SND_BUF. It is the amount of space which must be
00286    available in the tcp snd_buf for select to return writable */
00287 #ifndef TCP_SNDLOWAT
00288 #define TCP_SNDLOWAT                    TCP_SND_BUF/2
00289 #endif

00299 #define LWIP_CALLBACK_API               0
00300 #endif

00342 /* ---------- PPP options ---------- */

00344 #ifndef PPP_SUPPORT
00345 #define PPP_SUPPORT                     0      /* Set for PPP */
00346 #endif
00347 
00348 #if PPP_SUPPORT 
00349 
00350 #define NUM_PPP                         1      /* Max PPP sessions. */
00351 
00352 
00353 
00354 #ifndef PAP_SUPPORT
00355 #define PAP_SUPPORT                     0      /* Set for PAP. */
00356 #endif
00357 
00358 #ifndef CHAP_SUPPORT
00359 #define CHAP_SUPPORT                    0      /* Set for CHAP. */
00360 #endif
00361 
00362 #define MSCHAP_SUPPORT                  0      /* Set for MSCHAP (NOT FUNCTIONAL!) */
00363 #define CBCP_SUPPORT                    0      /* Set for CBCP (NOT FUNCTIONAL!) */
00364 #define CCP_SUPPORT                     0      /* Set for CCP (NOT FUNCTIONAL!) */
00365 
00366 #ifndef VJ_SUPPORT
00367 #define VJ_SUPPORT                      0      /* Set for VJ header compression. */
00368 #endif
00369 
00370 #ifndef MD5_SUPPORT
00371 #define MD5_SUPPORT                     0      /* Set for MD5 (see also CHAP) */
00372 #endif
00373 
00374 
00375 /*
00376  * Timeouts.
00377  */
00378 #define FSM_DEFTIMEOUT                  6       /* Timeout time in seconds */
00379 #define FSM_DEFMAXTERMREQS              2       /* Maximum Terminate-Request transmissions */
00380 #define FSM_DEFMAXCONFREQS              10      /* Maximum Configure-Request transmissions */
00381 #define FSM_DEFMAXNAKLOOPS              5       /* Maximum number of nak loops */
00382 
00383 #define UPAP_DEFTIMEOUT                 6       /* Timeout (seconds) for retransmitting req */
00384 #define UPAP_DEFREQTIME                 30      /* Time to wait for auth-req from peer */
00385 
00386 #define CHAP_DEFTIMEOUT                 6       /* Timeout time in seconds */
00387 #define CHAP_DEFTRANSMITS               10      /* max # times to send challenge */
00388 
00389 
00390 /* Interval in seconds between keepalive echo requests, 0 to disable. */
00391 #if 1
00392 #define LCP_ECHOINTERVAL                0
00393 #else
00394 #define LCP_ECHOINTERVAL                10
00395 #endif
00396 
00397 /* Number of unanswered echo requests before failure. */
00398 #define LCP_MAXECHOFAILS                3
00399 
00400 /* Max Xmit idle time (in jiffies) before resend flag char. */
00401 #define PPP_MAXIDLEFLAG                 100
00402 
00403 /*
00404  * Packet sizes
00405  *
00406  * Note - lcp shouldn't be allowed to negotiate stuff outside these
00407  *    limits.  See lcp.h in the pppd directory.
00408  * (XXX - these constants should simply be shared by lcp.c instead
00409  *    of living in lcp.h)
00410  */
00411 #define PPP_MTU                         1500     /* Default MTU (size of Info field) */
00412 #if 0
00413 #define PPP_MAXMTU  65535 - (PPP_HDRLEN + PPP_FCSLEN)
00414 #else
00415 #define PPP_MAXMTU                      1500 /* Largest MTU we allow */
00416 #endif
00417 #define PPP_MINMTU                      64
00418 #define PPP_MRU                         1500     /* default MRU = max length of info field */
00419 #define PPP_MAXMRU                      1500     /* Largest MRU we allow */
00420 #define PPP_DEFMRU                      296             /* Try for this */
00421 #define PPP_MINMRU                      128             /* No MRUs below this */
00422 
00423 
00424 #define MAXNAMELEN                      256     /* max length of hostname or name for auth */
00425 #define MAXSECRETLEN                    256     /* max length of password or secret */
00426 
00427 #endif /* PPP_SUPPORT */
00428
